statements: SELECT * FROM energy_consumption
SELECT meter_id, energy_usage, timestamp FROM energy_consumption
SELECT energy_usage, meter_id, timestamp FROM energy_consumption WHERE meter_id = 1
SELECT timestamp, meter_id, energy_usage FROM energy_consumption ORDER BY timestamp DESC
SELECT MAX(energy_usage) AS max_energy_usage FROM energy_consumption
SELECT * FROM energy_consumption WHERE meter_id = 1 ORDER BY timestamp DESC;
SELECT meter_id, timestamp FROM energy_consumption WHERE energy_usage > 100 ORDER BY energy_usage DESC, timestamp ASC;
SELECT energy_usage, timestamp FROM energy_consumption WHERE timestamp BETWEEN '2022-01-01' AND '2022-02-01' ORDER BY energy_usage DESC;
SELECT meter_id, timestamp, energy_usage FROM energy_consumption ORDER BY meter_id ASC, energy_usage DESC;
SELECT AVG(energy_usage) AS avg_usage, DATE(timestamp) AS date FROM energy_consumption GROUP BY DATE(timestamp) ORDER BY date ASC;
SELECT * FROM smart_meters
SELECT location, power_consumption FROM smart_meters
SELECT meter_id, location, power_consumption FROM smart_meters WHERE power_consumption > 100
SELECT * FROM energy_analysis
SELECT meter_id, analysis_date, peak_consumption FROM energy_analysis WHERE peak_consumption > 200
SELECT meter_id, location, power_consumption FROM smart_meters WHERE power_consumption > 100 ORDER BY power_consumption DESC;
SELECT analysis_id, meter_id, analysis_date, average_consumption, peak_consumption FROM energy_analysis WHERE analysis_date BETWEEN '2021-01-01' AND '2021-12-31' ORDER BY average_consumption ASC;
SELECT meter_id, location, DATE_FORMAT(date, '%Y-%m-%d') AS formatted_date, power_consumption FROM smart_meters WHERE location LIKE '%New York%' ORDER BY date DESC;
SELECT meter_id, location, AVG(power_consumption) AS avg_power_consumption FROM smart_meters GROUP BY location HAVING AVG(power_consumption) > 50 ORDER BY avg_power_consumption DESC;

SELECT analysis_id, meter_id, analysis_date, average_consumption, peak_consumption, location FROM energy_analysis JOIN smart_meters ON energy_analysis.meter_id = smart_meters.meter_id ORDER BY analysis_id ASC;
SELECT * FROM smart_meter_data
SELECT consumption, reading_time FROM smart_meter_data
SELECT meter_id, reading_time, consumption FROM smart_meter_data
SELECT * FROM meter_location
SELECT location_name, city, state FROM meter_location
SELECT * FROM smart_meter_data ORDER BY meter_id DESC
SELECT meter_id, reading_time, consumption FROM smart_meter_data WHERE consumption > 100 ORDER BY reading_time ASC
SELECT meter_id, location_name, city FROM meter_location WHERE city = 'New York'
SELECT meter_id, analysis_date, analysis_result FROM energy_analysis WHERE analysis_date BETWEEN '2022-01-01' AND '2022-02-01' ORDER BY analysis_date DESC
SELECT meter_id, location_name, city, state FROM meter_location INNER JOIN smart_meter_data ON smart_meter_data.meter_id = meter_location.meter_id
SELECT * FROM meters;
SELECT meter_id, model, installation_date FROM meters WHERE location = 'New York';
SELECT reading_id, timestamp, reading FROM readings ORDER BY timestamp DESC;
SELECT * FROM users WHERE username LIKE '%admin%';
SELECT city, country FROM locations ORDER BY city ASC;
SELECT * FROM meters WHERE location = 'New York' ORDER BY installation_date DESC;
SELECT reading_id, timestamp, reading FROM readings WHERE reading >= 100 ORDER BY timestamp ASC LIMIT 10;
SELECT model, installation_date FROM meters JOIN readings ON meters.meter_id = readings.meter_id WHERE reading <= 50 AND city = 'Chicago';
SELECT * FROM meters JOIN readings ON meters.meter_id = readings.meter_id JOIN locations ON meters.location = locations.city WHERE country = 'USA' ORDER BY reading DESC;
SELECT user_id, username FROM users WHERE email LIKE '%gmail.com%' ORDER BY user_id;
SELECT * FROM smart_meters;
SELECT meter_id, location FROM smart_meters WHERE reading > 100;
SELECT date, reading FROM meter_readings ORDER BY date DESC LIMIT 5;
SELECT id, usage FROM energy_consumption WHERE usage BETWEEN 50 AND 100;
SELECT meter_id, city, state FROM meter_locations WHERE city = 'New York';
SELECT * FROM smart_meters WHERE id = 1;
SELECT date, reading FROM meter_readings WHERE meter_id = 100 ORDER BY date DESC;
SELECT location, date FROM smart_meters WHERE date >= '2022-01-01';
SELECT meter_id, AVG(usage) AS avg_consumption FROM energy_consumption GROUP BY meter_id HAVING avg_consumption > 50;
SELECT city, state FROM meter_locations WHERE location LIKE '%Apartment%';
